1022  //============================================================================
1023  // Method Description:
1035  template<typename dtype>
1036  bool allclose(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, double inTolerance)
1037  {
1038  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
1039  {
1040  std::string errStr = "ERROR: allclose: input array dimensions are not consistant.";
1041  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1042  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1043  }
1044 
1045  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray1.size(); ++i)
1046  {
1047  if (std::abs(inArray1[i] - inArray2[i]) > inTolerance)
1048  {
1049  return false;
1050  }
1051  }
1052 
1053  return true;
1054  }

1123  //============================================================================
1124  // Method Description:
1137  template<typename dtype>
1138  NdArray<dtype> append(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inAppendValues, Axis inAxis)
1139  {
1140  switch (inAxis)
1141  {
1142  case Axis::NONE:
1143  {
1144  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() + inAppendValues.size());
1145  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1146  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1147 
1148  return std::move(returnArray);
1149  }
1150  case Axis::ROW:
1151  {
1152  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1153  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1154  if (inShape.cols != appendShape.cols)
1155  {
1156  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1157  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1158  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1159  }
1160 
1161  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows + appendShape.rows, inShape.cols);
1162  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1163  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1164 
1165  return std::move(returnArray);
1166  }
1167  case Axis::COL:
1168  {
1169  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1170  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1171  if (inShape.rows != appendShape.rows)
1172  {
1173  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1174  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1175  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1176  }
1177 
1178  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols + appendShape.cols);
1179  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
1180  {
1181  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row));
1182  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(row), inAppendValues.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row) + inShape.cols);
1183  }
1184 
1185  return std::move(returnArray);
1186  }
1187  default:
1188  {
1189  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1190  // of the compiler warning.
1191  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1192  }
1193  }
1194  }
1195 
1196  //============================================================================
1197  // Method Description:
1216  template<typename dtype>
1217  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, dtype inStep)
1218  {
1219  if (inStep > 0 && inStop < inStart)
1220  {
1221  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must be larger than the start value for positive step.";
1222  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1223  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1224  }
1225 
1226  if (inStep < 0 && inStop > inStart)
1227  {
1228  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: start value must be larger than the stop value for negative step.";
1229  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1230  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1231  }
1232 
1233  std::vector<dtype> values;
1234 
1235  dtype theValue = inStart;
1236 
1237  if (inStep > 0)
1238  {
1239  while (theValue < inStop)
1240  {
1241  values.push_back(theValue);
1242  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1243  }
1244  }
1245  else
1246  {
1247  while (theValue > inStop)
1248  {
1249  values.push_back(theValue);
1250  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1251  }
1252  }
1253 
1254  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
1255  }
1256 
1257  //============================================================================
1258  // Method Description:
1276  template<typename dtype>
1277  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStop)
1278  {
1279  if (inStop <= 0)
1280  {
1281  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must ge greater than 0.";
1282  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1283  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1284  }
1285 
1286  return std::move(arange<dtype>(0, inStop, 1));
1287  }

1808  //============================================================================
1809  // Method Description:
1820  template<typename dtype>
1821  NdArray<double> average(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, Axis inAxis)
1822  {
1823  switch (inAxis)
1824  {
1825  case Axis::NONE:
1826  {
1827  if (inWeights.shape() != inArray.shape())
1828  {
1829  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1830  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1831  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1832  }
1833 
1834  NdArray<double> weightedArray(inArray.shape());
1835  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1836 
1837  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1838  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= inWeights.template sum<double>().item() };
1839 
1840  return std::move(returnArray);
1841  }
1842  case Axis::COL:
1843  {
1844  Shape arrayShape = inArray.shape();
1845  if (inWeights.size() != arrayShape.cols)
1846  {
1847  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weights value are not consistant.";
1848  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1849  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1850  }
1851 
1852  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1853  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, arrayShape.rows);
1854  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
1855  {
1856  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, arrayShape.cols);
1857  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1858 
1859  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1860  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1861  }
1862 
1863  return std::move(returnArray);
1864  }
1865  case Axis::ROW:
1866  {
1867  if (inWeights.size() != inArray.shape().rows)
1868  {
1869  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1870  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1871  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1872  }
1873 
1874  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
1875 
1876  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
1877  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1878  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
1879  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
1880  {
1881  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, transShape.cols);
1882  std::transform(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1883 
1884  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1885  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1886  }
1887 
1888  return std::move(returnArray);
1889  }
1890  default:
1891  {
1892  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1893  // of the compiler warning.
1894  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
1895  }
1896  }
1897  }

1915  //============================================================================
1916  // Method Description:
1933  template<typename dtype>
1934  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint16 inMinLength)
1935  {
1936  // only works with integer input types
1937  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1938 
1939  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1940  if (maxValue < 0)
1941  {
1942  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1943  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1944  }
1945 
1946  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1947  {
1948  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1949  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1950  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1951  }
1952 
1953  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1954  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1955 
1956  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1957  outArray.zeros();
1958  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1959  {
1960  ++outArray[clippedArray[i]];
1961  }
1962 
1963  return std::move(outArray);
1964  }
1965 
1966  //============================================================================
1967  // Method Description:
1987  template<typename dtype>
1988  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, uint16 inMinLength)
1989  {
1990  // only works with integer input types
1991  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1992 
1993  if (inArray.shape() != inWeights.shape())
1994  {
1995  std::string errStr = "ERROR: bincount: weights array must be the same shape as the input array.";
1996  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1997  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1998  }
1999 
2000  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
2001  if (maxValue < 0)
2002  {
2003  // no positive values so just return an empty array
2004  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2005  }
2006 
2007  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
2008  {
2009  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
2010  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2011  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2012  }
2013 
2014  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
2015  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
2016 
2017  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
2018  outArray.zeros();
2019  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2020  {
2021  outArray[clippedArray[i]] += inWeights[i];
2022  }
2023 
2024  return std::move(outArray);
2025  }

2218  //============================================================================
2219  // Method Description:
2229  template<typename dtype>
2230  NdArray<dtype> column_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
2231  {
2232  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
2233  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2234  Shape finalShape;
2235  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2236  {
2237  if (finalShape.isnull())
2238  {
2239  finalShape = iter->shape();
2240  }
2241  else if (iter->shape().rows != finalShape.rows)
2242  {
2243  std::string errStr = "ERROR: column_stack: input arrays must have the same number of rows.";
2244  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2245  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2246  }
2247  else
2248  {
2249  finalShape.cols += iter->shape().cols;
2250  }
2251  }
2252 
2253  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
2254  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
2255  uint32 colStart = 0;
2256  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2257  {
2258  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
2259  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
2260  {
2261  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
2262  {
2263  returnArray(row, colStart + col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
2264  }
2265  }
2266  colStart += theShape.cols;
2267  }
2268 
2269  return std::move(returnArray);
2270  }
2271 
2272  //============================================================================
2273  // Method Description:
2283  template<typename dtype>
2284  NdArray<dtype> concatenate(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList, Axis inAxis)
2285  {
2286  switch (inAxis)
2287  {
2288  case Axis::NONE:
2289  {
2290  uint32 finalSize = 0;
2291  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2292  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2293  {
2294  finalSize += iter->size();
2295  }
2296 
2297  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, finalSize);
2298  uint32 offset = 0;
2299  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2300  {
2301  std::copy(iter->cbegin(), iter->cend(), returnArray.begin() + offset);
2302  offset += iter->size();
2303  }
2304 
2305  return std::move(returnArray);
2306  }
2307  case Axis::ROW:
2308  {
2309  return std::move(row_stack(inArrayList));
2310  }
2311  case Axis::COL:
2312  {
2313  return std::move(column_stack(inArrayList));
2314  }
2315  default:
2316  {
2317  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2318  // of the compiler warning.
2319  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2320  }
2321  }
2322  }

2478  // Method Description:
2488  template<typename dtype>
2489  NdArray<uint32> count_nonzero(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
2490  {
2491  switch (inAxis)
2492  {
2493  case Axis::NONE:
2494  {
2495  NdArray<uint32> count = { inArray.nonzero().size() };
2496  return count;
2497  }
2498  case Axis::COL:
2499  {
2500  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2501 
2502  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
2503  returnArray.zeros();
2504  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2505  {
2506  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2507  {
2508  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2509  {
2510  ++returnArray(0, row);
2511  }
2512  }
2513  }
2514 
2515  return std::move(returnArray);
2516  }
2517  case Axis::ROW:
2518  {
2519  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2520 
2521  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.cols);
2522  returnArray.zeros();
2523  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2524  {
2525  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2526  {
2527  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2528  {
2529  ++returnArray(0, col);
2530  }
2531  }
2532  }
2533 
2534  return std::move(returnArray);
2535  }
2536  default:
2537  {
2538  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2539  // of the compiler warning.
2540  return std::move(NdArray<uint32>(0));
2541  }
2542  }
2543  }

2545  //============================================================================
2546  // Method Description:
2557  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
2558  NdArray<dtypeOut> cross(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, Axis inAxis)
2559  {
2560  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
2561  {
2562  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: the input array dimensions are not consistant.";
2563  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2564  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2565  }
2566 
2567  switch (inAxis)
2568  {
2569  case Axis::NONE:
2570  {
2571  uint32 arraySize = inArray1.size();
2572  if (arraySize != inArray2.size() || arraySize < 2 || arraySize > 3)
2573  {
2574  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2575  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2576  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2577  }
2578 
2579  NdArray<dtype> in1 = inArray1.flatten();
2580  NdArray<dtype> in2 = inArray2.flatten();
2581 
2582  switch (arraySize)
2583  {
2584  case 2:
2585  {
2586  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2587  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]) };
2588  return std::move(returnArray);
2589  }
2590  case 3:
2591  {
2592  dtypeOut i = static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2593  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1]);
2594  dtypeOut j = -(static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2595  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2596  dtypeOut k = (static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2597  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2598 
2599  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { i, j, k };
2600  return std::move(returnArray);
2601  }
2602  default:
2603  {
2604  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2605  // of the compiler warning.
2606  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2607  }
2608  }
2609  }
2610  case Axis::ROW:
2611  {
2612  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2613  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.rows < 2 || arrayShape.rows > 3)
2614  {
2615  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2616  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2617  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2618  }
2619 
2620  Shape returnArrayShape;
2621  if (arrayShape.rows == 2)
2622  {
2623  returnArrayShape = Shape(1, arrayShape.cols);
2624  }
2625  else
2626  {
2627  returnArrayShape = Shape(3, arrayShape.cols);
2628  }
2629 
2630  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2631  for (uint32 col = 0; col < arrayShape.cols; ++col)
2632  {
2633  int32 theCol = static_cast<int32>(col);
2634  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2635  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2636  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2637 
2638  returnArray.put({ 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 }, vecCross);
2639  }
2640 
2641  return std::move(returnArray);
2642  }
2643  case Axis::COL:
2644  {
2645  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2646  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.cols < 2 || arrayShape.cols > 3)
2647  {
2648  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2649  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2650  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2651  }
2652 
2653  Shape returnArrayShape;
2654  if (arrayShape.cols == 2)
2655  {
2656  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 1);
2657  }
2658  else
2659  {
2660  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 3);
2661  }
2662 
2663  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2664  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
2665  {
2666  int32 theRow = static_cast<int32>(row);
2667  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2668  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2669  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2670 
2671  returnArray.put({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.cols) }, vecCross);
2672  }
2673 
2674  return std::move(returnArray);
2675  }
2676  default:
2677  {
2678  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2679  // of the compiler warning.
2680  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2681  }
2682  }
2683  }

2823  //============================================================================
2824  // Method Description:
2833  template<typename dtype>
2834  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<uint32>& inArrayIdxs, Axis inAxis)
2835  {
2836  // make sure that the indices are unique first
2837  NdArray<uint32> indices = unique(inArrayIdxs);
2838 
2839  switch (inAxis)
2840  {
2841  case Axis::NONE:
2842  {
2843  std::vector<dtype> values;
2844  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2845  {
2846  if (indices.contains(i).item())
2847  {
2848  continue;
2849  }
2850 
2851  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
2852  }
2853 
2854  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
2855  }
2856  case Axis::ROW:
2857  {
2858  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2859  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.rows)
2860  {
2861  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of rows in the array.";
2862  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2863  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2864  }
2865 
2866  uint32 numNewRows = inShape.rows - indices.size();
2867  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(numNewRows, inShape.cols);
2868 
2869  uint32 rowCounter = 0;
2870  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2871  {
2872  if (indices.contains(row).item())
2873  {
2874  continue;
2875  }
2876 
2877  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2878  {
2879  returnArray(rowCounter, col) = inArray(row, col);
2880  }
2881  ++rowCounter;
2882  }
2883 
2884  return std::move(returnArray);
2885  }
2886  case Axis::COL:
2887  {
2888  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2889  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.cols)
2890  {
2891  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of cols in the array.";
2892  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2893  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2894  }
2895 
2896  uint32 numNewCols = inShape.cols - indices.size();
2897  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, numNewCols);
2898 
2899  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2900  {
2901  uint32 colCounter = 0;
2902  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2903  {
2904  if (indices.contains(col).item())
2905  {
2906  continue;
2907  }
2908 
2909  returnArray(row, colCounter++) = inArray(row, col);
2910  }
2911  }
2912 
2913  return std::move(returnArray);
2914 
2915 
2916  }
2917  default:
2918  {
2919  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2920  // of the compiler warning.
2921  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2922  }
2923  }
2924  }
2925 
2926  //============================================================================
2927  // Method Description:
2936  template<typename dtype>
2937  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const Slice& inIndicesSlice, Axis inAxis)
2938  {
2939  Slice sliceCopy(inIndicesSlice);
2940 
2941  switch (inAxis)
2942  {
2943  case Axis::NONE:
2944  {
2945  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.size());
2946  break;
2947  }
2948  case Axis::ROW:
2949  {
2950  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().cols);
2951  break;
2952  }
2953  case Axis::COL:
2954  {
2955  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().rows);
2956  break;
2957  }
2958  }
2959 
2960  std::vector<uint32> indices;
2961  for (uint32 i = static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.start); i < static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.stop); i += sliceCopy.step)
2962  {
2963  indices.push_back(i);
2964  }
2965 
2966  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, NdArray<uint32>(indices), inAxis));
2967  }

2981  {
2982  NdArray<uint32> inIndices = { inIndex };
2983  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, inIndices, inAxis));
2984  }

3028  //============================================================================
3029  // Method Description:
3040  template<typename dtype>
3041  NdArray<dtype> diff(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
3042  {
3043  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
3044 
3045  switch (inAxis)
3046  {
3047  case Axis::NONE:
3048  {
3049  if (inArray.size() < 2)
3050  {
3051  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3052  }
3053 
3054  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - 1);
3055  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend() - 1, inArray.cbegin() + 1, returnArray.begin(),
3056  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3057 
3058  return std::move(returnArray);
3059  }
3060  case Axis::COL:
3061  {
3062  if (inShape.cols < 2)
3063  {
3064  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3065  }
3066 
3067  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols - 1);
3068  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
3069  {
3070  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row) - 1, inArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3071  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3072  }
3073 
3074  return std::move(returnArray);
3075  }
3076  case Axis::ROW:
3077  {
3078  if (inShape.rows < 2)
3079  {
3080  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3081  }
3082 
3083  NdArray<dtype> transArray = inArray.transpose();
3084  Shape transShape = transArray.shape();
3085  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(transShape.rows, transShape.cols - 1);
3086  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
3087  {
3088  std::transform(transArray.cbegin(row), transArray.cend(row) - 1, transArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3089  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3090  }
3091 
3092  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3093  }
3094  default:
3095  {
3096  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
3097  // of the compiler warning.
3098  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3099  }
3100  }
3101  }

3459  template<typename dtype>
3460  NdArray<dtype> eye(uint32 inN, uint32 inM, int32 inK)
3461  {
3462  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN, inM);
3463  returnArray.zeros();
3464 
3465  if (inK < 0)
3466  {
3467  uint32 col = 0;
3468  for (uint32 row = inK; row < inN; ++row)
3469  {
3470  if (col >= inM)
3471  {
3472  break;
3473  }
3474 
3475  returnArray(row, col++) = 1;
3476  }
3477  }
3478  else
3479  {
3480  uint32 row = 0;
3481  for (uint32 col = inK; col < inM; ++col)
3482  {
3483  if (row >= inN)
3484  {
3485  break;
3486  }
3487 
3488  returnArray(row++, col) = 1;
3489  }
3490  }
3491 
3492  return std::move(returnArray);
3493  }

3619  template<typename dtype>
3620  NdArray<dtype> flip(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
3621  {

3623  {
3624  case Axis::NONE:
3625  {
3626  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3627  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.end());
3628  return std::move(returnArray);
3629  }
3630  case Axis::COL:
3631  {
3632  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3633  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3634  {
3635  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3636  }
3637  return std::move(returnArray);
3638  }
3639  case Axis::ROW:
3640  {
3641  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
3642  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3643  {
3644  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3645  }
3646  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3647  }
3648  default:
3649  {
3650  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3651  }
3652  }
3653  }

3938  // Method Description:
3950  template<typename dtype>
3951  NdArray<dtype> fromfile(const std::string& inFilename, const std::string& inSep)
3952  {
3953  boost::filesystem::path p(inFilename);
3954  if (!boost::filesystem::exists(inFilename))
3955  {
3956  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: input filename does not exist.\n\t" + inFilename;
3957  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3958  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3959  }
3960 
3961  if (inSep.compare("") == 0)
3962  {
3963  // read in as binary file
3964  std::ifstream in(inFilename.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
3965  in.seekg(0, in.end);
3966  uint32 fileSize = static_cast<uint32>(in.tellg());
3967 
3968  FILE* filePtr = fopen(inFilename.c_str(), "rb");
3969  if (filePtr == NULL)
3970  {
3971  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open the file.";
3972  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3973  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3974  }
3975 
3976  char* fileBuffer = new char[fileSize];
3977  size_t bytesRead = fread(fileBuffer, sizeof(char), fileSize, filePtr);
3978  fclose(filePtr);
3979 
3980  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(reinterpret_cast<dtype*>(fileBuffer), static_cast<uint32>(bytesRead));
3981  delete[] fileBuffer;
3982 
3983  return std::move(returnArray);
3984  }
3985  else
3986  {
3987  // read in as txt file
3988  if (!(inSep.compare(" ") == 0 || inSep.compare("\t") == 0 || inSep.compare("\n") == 0))
3989  {
3990  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: only [' ', '\\t', '\\n'] seperators are supported";
3991  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3992  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3993  }
3994 
3995  std::vector<dtype> values;
3996 
3997  std::ifstream file(inFilename.c_str());
3998  if (file.is_open())
3999  {
4000  while (!file.eof())
4001  {
4002  std::string line;
4003  std::getline(file, line);
4004 
4005  std::istringstream iss(line);
4006  try
4007  {
4008  values.push_back(static_cast<dtype>(std::stod(iss.str())));
4009  }
4010  catch (const std::invalid_argument& ia)
4011  {
4012  std::cout << "Warning: fromfile: " << ia.what() << std::endl;
4014  }
4015  }
4016  file.close();
4017  }
4018  else
4019  {
4020  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open file.";
4021  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4022  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4023  }
4024 
4025  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
4026  }
4027  }

4171  //============================================================================
4172  // Method Description:
4183  template<typename dtype>
4184  NdArray<double> gradient(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis = Axis::ROW)
4185  {
4186  switch (inAxis)
4187  {
4188  case Axis::ROW:
4189  {
4190  auto inShape = inArray.shape();
4191  if (inShape.rows < 2)
4192  {
4193  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 row.";
4194  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4195  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4196  }
4197 
4198  // first do the first and last rows
4199  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(inShape);
4200  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
4201  {
4202  returnArray(0, col) = static_cast<double>(inArray(1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(0, col));
4203  returnArray(-1, col) = static_cast<double>(inArray(-1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(-2, col));
4204  }
4205 
4206  // then rip through the rest of the array
4207  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
4208  {
4209  for (uint32 row = 1; row < inShape.rows - 1; ++row)
4210  {
4211  returnArray(row, col) = (static_cast<double>(inArray(row + 1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row - 1, col))) / 2.0;
4212  }
4213  }
4214 
4215  return std::move(returnArray);
4216  }
4217  case Axis::COL:
4218  {
4219  auto inShape = inArray.shape();
4220  if (inShape.cols < 2)
4221  {
4222  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 columns.";
4223  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4224  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4225  }
4226 
4227  // first do the first and last columns
4228  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(inShape);
4229  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
4230  {
4231  returnArray(row, 0) = static_cast<double>(inArray(row, 1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, 0));
4232  returnArray(row, -1) = static_cast<double>(inArray(row, -1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, -2));
4233  }
4234 
4235  // then rip through the rest of the array
4236  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
4237  {
4238  for (uint32 col = 1; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
4239  {
4240  returnArray(row, col) = (static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col - 1))) / 2.0;
4241  }
4242  }
4243 
4244  return std::move(returnArray);
4245  }
4246  default:
4247  {
4248  // will return the gradient of the flattened array
4249  if (inArray.size() < 2)
4250  {
4251  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 element.";
4252  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4253  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4254  }
4255 
4256  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(1, inArray.size());
4257  returnArray[0] = static_cast<double>(inArray[1]) - static_cast<double>(inArray[0]);
4258  returnArray[-1] = static_cast<double>(inArray[-1]) - static_cast<double>(inArray[-2]);
4259  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inArray.size() - 1; ++i)
4260  {
4261  returnArray[i] = (static_cast<double>(inArray[i + 1]) - static_cast<double>(inArray[i - 1])) / 2.0;
4262  }
4263 
4264  return std::move(returnArray);
4265  }
4266  }
4267  }

4305  //============================================================================
4306  // Method Description:
4318  template<typename dtype>
4319  std::pair<NdArray<uint32>, NdArray<double> > histogram(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inNumBins)
4320  {
4321  if (inNumBins == 0)
4322  {
4323  std::string errStr = "ERROR: histogram: number of bins must be positive.";
4324  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4325  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4326  }
4327 
4328  NdArray<uint32> histo = zeros<uint32>(1, inNumBins);
4329 
4330  bool useEndPoint = true;
4331  NdArray<double> binEdges = linspace(static_cast<double>(inArray.min().item()),
4332  static_cast<double>(inArray.max().item()), inNumBins + 1, useEndPoint);
4333 
4334  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
4335  {
4336  // binary search to find the bin idx
4337  bool keepSearching = true;
4338  uint32 lowIdx = 0;
4339  uint32 highIdx = binEdges.size() - 1;
4340  while (keepSearching)
4341  {
4342  uint32 idx = (lowIdx + highIdx) / 2; // integer division
4343  if (lowIdx == highIdx || lowIdx == highIdx - 1)
4344  {
4345  // we found the bin
4346  ++histo[lowIdx];
4347  break;
4348  }
4349 
4350  if (inArray[i] > binEdges[idx])
4351  {
4352  lowIdx = idx;
4353  }
4354  else if (inArray[i] < binEdges[idx])
4355  {
4356  highIdx = idx;
4357  }
4358  else
4359  {
4360  // we found the bin
4361  ++histo[idx];
4362  break;
4363  }
4364  }
4365  }
4366 
4367  return std::move(std::make_pair(histo, binEdges));
4368  }

4485  //============================================================================
4486  // Method Description:
4503  template<typename dtype>
4504  NdArray<dtype> interp(const NdArray<dtype>& inX, const NdArray<dtype>& inXp, const NdArray<dtype>& inFp)
4505  {
4506  // do some error checking first
4507  if (inXp.size() != inFp.size())
4508  {
4509  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: inXp and inFp need to be the same size().";
4510  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4511  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4512  }
4513 
4514  if (inX.min().item() < inXp.min().item() || inX.max().item() > inXp.max().item())
4515  {
4516  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: endpoints of inX should be contained within inXp.";
4517  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4518  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4519  }
4520 
4521  // sort the input inXp and inFp data
4522  NdArray<uint32> sortedXpIdxs = argsort(inXp);
4523  NdArray<dtype> sortedXp(1, inFp.size());
4524  NdArray<dtype> sortedFp(1, inFp.size());
4525  for (uint32 i = 0; i < sortedXpIdxs.size(); ++i)
4526  {
4527  sortedXp[i] = inXp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4528  sortedFp[i] = inFp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4529  }
4530 
4531  // sort the input inX array
4532  NdArray<dtype> sortedX = sort(inX);
4533 
4534  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inX.size());
4535 
4536  uint32 currXpIdx = 0;
4537  uint32 currXidx = 0;
4538  while (currXidx < sortedX.size())
4539  {
4540  if (sortedXp[currXpIdx] <= sortedX[currXidx] && sortedX[currXidx] <= sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1])
4541  {
4542  double percent = static_cast<double>(sortedX[currXidx] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]) /
4543  static_cast<double>(sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]);
4544  returnArray[currXidx++] = Utils::interp(sortedFp[currXpIdx], sortedFp[currXpIdx + 1], percent);
4545  }
4546  else
4547  {
4548  ++currXpIdx;
4549  }
4550  }
4551 
4552  return std::move(returnArray);
4553  }
4554 
4555  //============================================================================
4556  // Method Description:
4569  template<typename dtype>
4570  NdArray<dtype> intersect1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
4571  {
4572  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
4573  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
4574  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
4575 
4576  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_intersection(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
4577  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
4578  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
4579  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
4580  }

4631

4866  //============================================================================
4867  // Method Description:
4888  template<typename dtype>
4889  NdArray<dtype> linspace(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, uint32 inNum, bool endPoint)
4890  {
4891  if (inNum == 0)
4892  {
4893  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
4894  }
4895  else if (inNum == 1)
4896  {
4897  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart };
4898  return std::move(returnArray);
4899  }
4900 
4901  if (inStop <= inStart)
4902  {
4903  std::string errStr = "ERROR: linspace: stop value must be greater than the start value.";
4904  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4905  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4906  }
4907 
4908  if (endPoint)
4909  {
4910  if (inNum == 2)
4911  {
4912  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStop };
4913  return std::move(returnArray);
4914  }
4915  else
4916  {
4917  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4918  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4919  returnArray[inNum - 1] = inStop;
4920 
4921  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum - 1);
4922  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum - 1; ++i)
4923  {
4924  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4925  }
4926 
4927  return std::move(returnArray);
4928  }
4929  }
4930  else
4931  {
4932  if (inNum == 2)
4933  {
4934  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum);
4935  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStart + step };
4936  return std::move(returnArray);
4937  }
4938  else
4939  {
4940  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4941  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4942 
4943  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / inNum;
4944  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum; ++i)
4945  {
4946  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4947  }
4948 
4949  return std::move(returnArray);
4950  }
4951  }
4952  }

5345  //============================================================================
5346  // Method Description:
5360  template<typename dtype>
5361  std::pair<NdArray<dtype>, NdArray<dtype> > meshgrid(const NdArray<dtype>& inICoords, const NdArray<dtype>& inJCoords)
5362  {
5363  uint32 numRows = inJCoords.size();
5364  uint32 numCols = inICoords.size();
5365  auto returnArrayI = NdArray<dtype>(numRows, numCols);
5366  auto returnArrayJ = NdArray<dtype>(numRows, numCols);
5367 
5368  // first the I array
5369  for (uint32 row = 0; row < numRows; ++row)
5370  {
5371  for (uint32 col = 0; col < numCols; ++col)
5372  {
5373  returnArrayI(row, col) = inICoords[col];
5374  }
5375  }
5376 
5377  // then the I array
5378  for (uint32 col = 0; col < numCols; ++col)
5379  {
5380  for (uint32 row = 0; row < numRows; ++row)
5381  {
5382  returnArrayJ(row, col) = inJCoords[row];
5383  }
5384  }
5385 
5386  return std::make_pair(returnArrayI, returnArrayJ);
5387  }

5621  //============================================================================
5622  // Method Description:
5633  template<typename dtype>
5634  NdArray<double> nanmean(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5635  {
5636  switch (inAxis)
5637  {
5638  case Axis::NONE:
5639  {
5640  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5641  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5642 
5643  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5644  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5645 
5646  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= numberNonNan };
5647 
5648  return std::move(returnArray);
5649  }
5650  case Axis::COL:
5651  {
5652  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5653  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5654  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5655  {
5656  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5657  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5658 
5659  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5660  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5661 
5662  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5663  }
5664 
5665  return std::move(returnArray);
5666  }
5667  case Axis::ROW:
5668  {
5669  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5670  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
5671  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
5672  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
5673  {
5674  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5675  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5676 
5677  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5678  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5679 
5680  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5681  }
5682 
5683  return std::move(returnArray);
5684  }
5685  default:
5686  {
5687  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5688  // of the compiler warning.
5689  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5690  }
5691  }
5692  }
5693 
5694  //============================================================================
5695  // Method Description:
5706  template<typename dtype>
5707  NdArray<dtype> nanmedian(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5708  {
5709  switch (inAxis)
5710  {
5711  case Axis::NONE:
5712  {
5713  std::vector<dtype> values;
5714  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5715  {
5716  if (!std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5717  {
5718  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
5719  }
5720  }
5721 
5722  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5723  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5724  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { values[middle] };
5725 
5726  return std::move(returnArray);
5727  }
5728  case Axis::COL:
5729  {
5730  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5731  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5732  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5733  {
5734  std::vector<dtype> values;
5735  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5736  {
5737  if (!std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5738  {
5739  values.push_back(inArray(row, col));
5740  }
5741  }
5742 
5743  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5744  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5745  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5746  }
5747 
5748  return std::move(returnArray);
5749  }
5750  case Axis::ROW:
5751  {
5752  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5753  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5754  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5755  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5756  {
5757  std::vector<dtype> values;
5758  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5759  {
5760  if (!std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5761  {
5762  values.push_back(transposedArray(row, col));
5763  }
5764  }
5765 
5766  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5767  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5768  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5769  }
5770 
5771  return std::move(returnArray);
5772  }
5773  default:
5774  {
5775  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5776  // of the compiler warning.
5777  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
5778  }
5779  }
5780  }

5783  // Method Description:
5794  template<typename dtype>
5795  NdArray<dtype> nanmin(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5796  {
5797  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5798  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
5799  {
5800  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
5801  {
5802  arrayCopy[i] = DtypeInfo<dtype>::max();
5803  }
5804  }
5805 
5806  return std::move(min(arrayCopy, inAxis));
5807  }

5809  //============================================================================
5810  // Method Description:
5822  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5823  NdArray<double> nanpercentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
5824  {
5825  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
5826  {
5827  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
5828  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5829  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5830  }
5831 
5832  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
5833  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
5834  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
5835  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
5836  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
5837  {
5838  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
5839  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
5840  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5841  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5842  }
5843 
5844  switch (inAxis)
5845  {
5846  case Axis::NONE:
5847  {
5848  if (inPercentile == 0)
5849  {
5850  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5851  {
5852  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5853  {
5854  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5855  return std::move(returnArray);
5856  }
5857  }
5858  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5859  }
5860  else if (inPercentile == 1)
5861  {
5862  for (int32 i = static_cast<int32>(inArray.size()) - 1; i > -1; --i)
5863  {
5864  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5865  {
5866  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5867  return std::move(returnArray);
5868  }
5869  }
5870  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5871  }
5872 
5873  std::vector<double> arrayCopy;
5874  uint32 numNonNan = 0;
5875  for (uint32 j = 0; j < inArray.size(); ++j)
5876  {
5877  if (!isnan(inArray[j]))
5878  {
5879  arrayCopy.push_back(inArray[j]);
5880  ++numNonNan;
5881  }
5882  }
5883 
5884  if (arrayCopy.size() < 2)
5885  {
5886  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5887  }
5888 
5889  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
5890  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, numNonNan - 2));
5891 
5892  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
5893 
5894  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
5895  {
5896  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5897  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
5898  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) - percentI);
5899 
5900  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
5901  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
5902  return std::move(returnArray);
5903  }
5904  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
5905  {
5906  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5907  return std::move(returnArray);
5908  }
5909  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
5910  {
5911  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5912  return std::move(returnArray);
5913  }
5914  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
5915  {
5916  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
5917  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5918  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5919  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
5920  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
5921 
5922  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
5923  {
5924  case 0:
5925  {
5926  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5927  return std::move(returnArray);
5928  }
5929  case 1:
5930  {
5931  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5932  return std::move(returnArray);
5933  }
5934  }
5935  }
5936  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
5937  {
5938  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { (arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0 };
5939  return std::move(returnArray);
5940  }
5941  }
5942  case Axis::COL:
5943  {
5944  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5945 
5946  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5947  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5948  {
5949  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
5950  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5951 
5952  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5953  {
5954  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5955  }
5956  else
5957  {
5958  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5959  }
5960  }
5961 
5962  return std::move(returnArray);
5963  }
5964  case Axis::ROW:
5965  {
5966  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
5967  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
5968 
5969  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5970  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5971  {
5972  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
5973  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5974 
5975  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5976  {
5977  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5978  }
5979  else
5980  {
5981  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5982  }
5983  }
5984 
5985  return std::move(returnArray);
5986  }
5987  default:
5988  {
5989  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5990  // of the compiler warning.
5991  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5992  }
5993  }
5994  }
5995

6008  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
6009  NdArray<dtypeOut> nanprod(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
6010  {
6011  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
6012  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
6013  {
6014  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
6015  {
6016  arrayCopy[i] = 1;
6017  }
6018  }
6019 
6020  return std::move(prod<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));
6021  }

6089  // Method Description:
6100  template<typename dtype>
6101  NdArray<double> nanstd(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
6102  {
6103  switch (inAxis)
6104  {
6105  case Axis::NONE:
6106  {
6107  double meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis).item();
6108  double sum = 0;
6109  double counter = 0;
6110  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
6111  {
6112  if (std::isnan(inArray[i]))
6113  {
6114  continue;
6115  }
6116 
6117  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray[i]) - meanValue);
6118  ++counter;
6119  }
6120  NdArray<double> returnArray = { std::sqrt(sum / counter) };
6121  return std::move(returnArray);
6122  }
6123  case Axis::COL:
6124  {
6125  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6126  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
6127  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6128  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6129  {
6130  double sum = 0;
6131  double counter = 0;
6132  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
6133  {
6134  if (std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
6135  {
6136  continue;
6137  }
6138 
6139  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
6140  ++counter;
6141  }
6142  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
6143  }
6144 
6145  return std::move(returnArray);
6146  }
6147  case Axis::ROW:
6148  {
6149  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
6150  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
6151  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
6152  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6153  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6154  {
6155  double sum = 0;
6156  double counter = 0;
6157  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
6158  {
6159  if (std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
6160  {
6161  continue;
6162  }
6163 
6164  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(transposedArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
6165  ++counter;
6166  }
6167  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
6168  }
6169 
6170  return std::move(returnArray);
6171  }
6172  default:
6173  {
6174  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6175  // of the compiler warning.
6176  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
6177  }
6178  }
6179  }

6481  //============================================================================
6482  // Method Description:
6499  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
6500  NdArray<dtypeOut> percentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
6501  {
6502  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
6503  {
6504  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
6505  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6506  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6507  }
6508 
6509  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
6510  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
6511  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
6512  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
6513  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
6514  {
6515  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
6516  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
6517  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6518  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6519  }
6520 
6521  switch (inAxis)
6522  {
6523  case Axis::NONE:
6524  {
6525  if (inPercentile == 0)
6526  {
6527  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cbegin()) };
6528  return std::move(returnArray);
6529  }
6530  else if (inPercentile == 1)
6531  {
6532  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(*inArray.cend()) };
6533  return std::move(returnArray);
6534  }
6535 
6536  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
6537  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, inArray.size() - 2));
6538 
6539  NdArray<double> arrayCopy = inArray.template astype<double>();
6540  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
6541 
6542  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
6543  {
6544  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6545  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
6546  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) - percentI);
6547 
6548  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
6549  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
6550  return std::move(returnArray);
6551  }
6552  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
6553  {
6554  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6555  return std::move(returnArray);
6556  }
6557  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
6558  {
6559  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6560  return std::move(returnArray);
6561  }
6562  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
6563  {
6564  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
6565  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6566  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6567  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
6568  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
6569 
6570  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
6571  {
6572  case 0:
6573  {
6574  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6575  return std::move(returnArray);
6576  }
6577  case 1:
6578  {
6579  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6580  return std::move(returnArray);
6581  }
6582  }
6583  }
6584  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
6585  {
6586  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>((arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0) };
6587  return std::move(returnArray);
6588  }
6589  }
6590  case Axis::COL:
6591  {
6592  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6593 
6594  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6595  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6596  {
6597  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
6598  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6599  }
6600 
6601  return std::move(returnArray);
6602  }
6603  case Axis::ROW:
6604  {
6605  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
6606  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
6607 
6608  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6609  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6610  {
6611  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
6612  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6613  }
6614 
6615  return std::move(returnArray);
6616  }
6617  default:
6618  {
6619  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6620  // of the compiler warning.
6621  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
6622  }
6623  }
6624  }
6625

6641  }

7172  //============================================================================
7173  // Method Description:
7185  template<typename dtype>
7186  NdArray<dtype> roll(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, int32 inShift, Axis inAxis)
7187  {
7188  switch (inAxis)
7189  {
7190  case Axis::NONE:
7191  {
7192  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inArray.size();
7193  if (inShift > 0)
7194  {
7195  shift = inArray.size() - shift;
7196  }
7197 
7198  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
7199  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.begin() + shift, returnArray.end());
7200 
7201  return std::move(returnArray);
7202  }
7203  case Axis::COL:
7204  {
7205  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7206 
7207  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.cols;
7208  if (inShift > 0)
7209  {
7210  shift = inShape.cols - shift;
7211  }
7212 
7213  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
7214  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
7215  {
7216  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
7217  }
7218 
7219  return std::move(returnArray);
7220  }
7221  case Axis::ROW:
7222  {
7223  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7224 
7225  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.rows;
7226  if (inShift > 0)
7227  {
7228  shift = inShape.rows - shift;
7229  }
7230 
7231  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
7232  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.cols; ++row)
7233  {
7234  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
7235  }
7236 
7237  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
7238  }
7239  default:
7240  {
7241  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7242  // of the compiler warning.
7243  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7244  }
7245  }
7246  }
7247 
7248  //============================================================================
7249  // Method Description:
7260  template<typename dtype>
7261  NdArray<dtype> rot90(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint8 inK)
7262  {
7263  inK %= 4;
7264  switch (inK)
7265  {
7266  case 1:
7267  {
7268  return std::move(flipud(inArray.transpose()));
7269  }
7270  case 2:
7271  {
7272  return std::move(flip(inArray, Axis::NONE));
7273  }
7274  case 3:
7275  {
7276  return std::move(fliplr(inArray.transpose()));
7277  }
7278  default:
7279  {
7280  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7281  // of the compiler warning.
7282  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7283  }
7284  }
7285  }

7320  //============================================================================
7321  // Method Description:
7330  template<typename dtype>
7331  NdArray<dtype> row_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
7332  {
7333  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
7334  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
7335  Shape finalShape;
7336  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
7337  {
7338  if (finalShape.isnull())
7339  {
7340  finalShape = iter->shape();
7341  }
7342  else if (iter->shape().cols != finalShape.cols)
7343  {
7344  std::string errStr = "ERROR: row_stack: input arrays must have the same number of columns.";
7345  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7346  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7347  }
7348  else
7349  {
7350  finalShape.rows += iter->shape().rows;
7351  }
7352  }
7353 
7354  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
7355  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
7356  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7357  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
7358  {
7359  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
7360  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
7361  {
7362  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
7363  {
7364  returnArray(rowStart + row, col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
7365  }
7366  }
7367  rowStart += theShape.rows;
7368  }
7369 
7370  return std::move(returnArray);
7371  }

7373  //============================================================================
7374  // Method Description:
7386  template<typename dtype>
7387  NdArray<dtype> setdiff1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
7388  {
7389  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
7390  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
7391  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
7392 
7393  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_difference(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
7394  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
7395  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
7396  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
7397  }

7666  template<typename dtype>

7991  //============================================================================
7992  // Method Description:
8004  template<typename dtype>
8005  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double dx, Axis inAxis)
8006  {
8007  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
8008  switch (inAxis)
8009  {
8010  case Axis::COL:
8011  {
8012  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShape.rows, 1);
8013  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
8014  {
8015  double sum = 0;
8016  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
8017  {
8018  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1) - inArray(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col));
8019  }
8020 
8021  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
8022  }
8023 
8024  return std::move(returnArray);
8025  }
8026  case Axis::ROW:
8027  {
8028  NdArray<dtype> arrayTranspose = inArray.transpose();
8029  Shape transShape = arrayTranspose.shape();
8030  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
8031  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
8032  {
8033  double sum = 0;
8034  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
8035  {
8036  sum += static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col));
8037  }
8038 
8039  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
8040  }
8041 
8042  return std::move(returnArray);
8043  }
8044  case Axis::NONE:
8045  {
8046  double sum = 0.0;
8047  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size() - 1; ++i)
8048  {
8049  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray[i + 1] - inArray[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray[i]);
8050  }
8051 
8052  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum * dx };
8053  return std::move(returnArray);
8054  }
8055  default:
8056  {
8057  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
8058  // of the compiler warning.
8059  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
8060  }
8061  }
8062  }
8063 
8064  //============================================================================
8065  // Method Description:
8077  template<typename dtype>
8078  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayY, const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayX, Axis inAxis)
8079  {
8080  Shape inShapeY = inArrayY.shape();
8081  Shape inShapeX = inArrayX.shape();
8082 
8083  if (inShapeY != inShapeX)
8084  {
8085  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trapz: input x and y arrays should be the same shape.";
8086  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8087  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8088  }
8089 
8090  switch (inAxis)
8091  {
8092  case Axis::COL:
8093  {
8094  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShapeY.rows, 1);
8095  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShapeY.rows; ++row)
8096  {
8097  double sum = 0;
8098  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShapeY.cols - 1; ++col)
8099  {
8100  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX(row, col + 1) - inArrayX(row, col));
8101  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col + 1) - inArrayY(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col)));
8102  }
8103 
8104  returnArray[row] = sum;
8105  }
8106 
8107  return std::move(returnArray);
8108  }
8109  case Axis::ROW:
8110  {
8111  NdArray<dtype> arrayYTranspose = inArrayY.transpose();
8112  NdArray<dtype> arrayXTranspose = inArrayX.transpose();
8113  Shape transShape = arrayYTranspose.shape();
8114  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
8115  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
8116  {
8117  double sum = 0;
8118  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
8119  {
8120  double dx = static_cast<double>(arrayXTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayXTranspose(row, col));
8121  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayYTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col)));
8122  }
8123 
8124  returnArray[row] = sum;
8125  }
8126 
8127  return std::move(returnArray);
8128  }
8129  case Axis::NONE:
8130  {
8131  double sum = 0.0;
8132  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArrayY.size() - 1; ++i)
8133  {
8134  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX[i + 1] - inArrayX[i]);
8135  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i + 1] - inArrayY[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i]));
8136  }
8137 
8138  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum };
8139  return std::move(returnArray);
8140  }
8141  default:
8142  {
8143  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
8144  // of the compiler warning.
8145  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
8146  }
8147  }
8148  }

8150  //============================================================================
8151  // Method Description:
8163  template<typename dtype>
8164  NdArray<dtype> tril(uint32 inN, int32 inOffset)
8165  {
8166  uint32 rowStart = 0;
8167  uint32 colStart = 0;
8168  if (inOffset > 0)
8169  {
8170  colStart = inOffset;
8171  }
8172  else
8173  {
8174  rowStart = inOffset * -1;
8175  }
8176 
8177  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN);
8178  returnArray.zeros();
8179  for (uint32 row = rowStart; row < inN; ++row)
8180  {
8181  for (uint32 col = 0; col < row + colStart + 1 - rowStart; ++col)
8182  {
8183  if (col == inN)
8184  {
8185  break;
8186  }
8187 
8188  returnArray(row, col) = static_cast<dtype>(1);
8189  }
8190  }
8191 
8192  return std::move(returnArray);
8193  }

8320  {

8322  {
8323  if (col == inM)
8324  {
8325  break;

8361  //============================================================================
8362  // Method Description:
8373  template<typename dtype>
8374  NdArray<dtype> trim_zeros(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const std::string inTrim)
8375  {
8376  if (inTrim == "f")
8377  {
8378  uint32 place = 0;
8379  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
8380  {
8381  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8382  {
8383  break;
8384  }
8385  else
8386  {
8387  ++place;
8388  }
8389  }
8390 
8391  if (place == inArray.size())
8392  {
8393  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8394  }
8395 
8396  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - place);
8397  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + place, inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
8398 
8399  return std::move(returnArray);
8400  }
8401  else if (inTrim == "b")
8402  {
8403  uint32 place = inArray.size();
8404  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8405  {
8406  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8407  {
8408  break;
8409  }
8410  else
8411  {
8412  --place;
8413  }
8414  }
8415 
8416  if (place == 0 || (place == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8417  {
8418  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8419  }
8420 
8421  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, place);
8422  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cbegin() + place, returnArray.begin());
8423 
8424  return std::move(returnArray);
8425  }
8426  else if (inTrim == "fb")
8427  {
8428  uint32 placeBegin = 0;
8429  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
8430  {
8431  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8432  {
8433  break;
8434  }
8435  else
8436  {
8437  ++placeBegin;
8438  }
8439  }
8440 
8441  if (placeBegin == inArray.size())
8442  {
8443  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8444  }
8445 
8446  uint32 placeEnd = inArray.size();
8447  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8448  {
8449  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8450  {
8451  break;
8452  }
8453  else
8454  {
8455  --placeEnd;
8456  }
8457  }
8458 
8459  if (placeEnd == 0 || (placeEnd == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8460  {
8461  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8462  }
8463 
8464  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, placeEnd - placeBegin);
8465  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + placeBegin, inArray.cbegin() + placeEnd, returnArray.begin());
8466 
8467  return std::move(returnArray);
8468  }
8469  else
8470  {
8471  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trim_zeros: trim options are 'f' = front, 'b' = back, 'fb' = front and back.";
8472  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8473  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8474  }
8475  }

8568  // Method Description:
8579  template<typename dtype>
8580  dtype unwrap(dtype inValue)
8581  {
8582  if (inValue < 0)
8583  {
8584  return inValue + 2 * Constants::pi;
8585  }
8586  else if (inValue >= 2 * Constants::pi)
8587  {
8588  return inValue - 2 * Constants::pi;
8589  }
8590  else
8591  {
8592  return inValue;
8593  }
8594  }

8654  //============================================================================
8655  // Method Description:
8667  template<typename dtype>
8668  NdArray<dtype> where(const NdArray<bool>& inMask, const NdArray<dtype>& inA, const NdArray<dtype>& inB)
8669  {
8670  auto shapeMask = inMask.shape();
8671  auto shapeA = inA.shape();
8672  if (shapeA != inB.shape())
8673  {
8674  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inA and inB must be the same shapes.";
8675  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8676  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8677  }
8678 
8679  if (shapeMask != shapeA)
8680  {
8681  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inMask must be the same shape as the input arrays.";
8682  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8683  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8684  }
8685 
8686  auto outArray = NdArray<dtype>(shapeMask);
8687 
8688  for (uint32 i = 0; i < shapeMask.size(); ++i)
8689  {
8690  if (inMask[i])
8691  {
8692  outArray[i] = inA[i];
8693  }
8694  else
8695  {
8696  outArray[i] = inB[i];
8697  }
8698  }
8699 
8700  return std::move(outArray);
8701  }

8749  NC::NdArray<dtype> zeros(const NC::Shape& inShape)
8750  {
8751  return std::move(full(inShape, static_cast<dtype>(0)));
8752  }

8766  NdArray<dtypeOut> zeros_like(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray)
8767  {
8768  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(inArray.shape());
8769  returnArray.zeros();
8770  return std::move(returnArray);
8771  }
8772 }
